definition: ashamed of being inferior (idiom)/to feel inferior to others
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
ashamed
(negative prefix)/not/no
as/as if/such as

sentences.english: Next to them, we can only hang our head in shame over our own capacity to adapt.
sentences.chinese: 比起它們，人類對於自己的適應能力只能是自愧不如。

sentences.english: He's so clever, he makes me feel inferior.
sentences.chinese: 他是那麼聰明，使我自愧不如。

sentences.english: I feel ashamed of one's inferiority as the first day English only class student.
sentences.chinese: 我作爲初一英語班的學生自愧不如。

sentences.english: Her careful work put all the rest to shame.
sentences.chinese: 她的細緻工作使得其餘所有的人都自愧不如。

definition: to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
to feel ashamed at being inferior (idiom)
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
to admire
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
(to gasp) with admiration
to blush with shame (literary)
to admire greatly
to prostrate oneself in admiration (idiom); to adulate sb
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to esteem/to admire
to be full of praise (idiom)
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
to be worthy of/to deserve to be called/to prove oneself to be
to feel ashamed of one's inferiority (idiom)/to feel inferior
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
